title_en: More than a thousand teachers of Castile-La Mancha are demanding to cancel the cuts in the PP, which still remain in force
summary_en:
The CCOO, CSIF and STE unions are demanding the repeal of the education cuts approved by PP.
More than a thousand protesters marched from Socodover Square to the residence of the President of the Council of Communities.
The protesters' manifesto demands a reduction in academic workload, class rates and a reduction in bureaucracy.
Trade unions warn of the serious impact of the cuts on the quality of education in Castile-La Mancha.
They urge the regional government to discuss the improvement plan with the trade unions.
The Secretary General of the CCOO Castile-La Mancha Education Federation announces the beginning of mobilization.
Trade unions are demanding the abolition of cuts and support for public education.

title: –õ–∏–¥–µ—Ä Aslef –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–ª –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é —Å–¥–µ–ª–∫—É –ø–æ –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—â–µ–Ω–∏—é –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–æ–∫ –∂–µ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π
title_en: The leader of Aslef left the proposed deal to end the strikes of railway workers unread
summary_en:
The head of the Aslef machinists' union, Mick Whelan, did not open an email offering to end the strike.
Whelan has not met with Transportation Secretary Mark Harper since December 2022 and with Minister Hugh Merriman since January 2023.
The offer from Rail Delivery Group was sent to Whelan 10 minutes before it became known to the media.
The proposal called for a 4% salary increase over two years in exchange for adopting changed working methods.
Union members already knew about the proposal before the board meeting and protested against its consideration.
Whelan did not open the email out of caution and protest at the way the proposal was handled.
Other rail unions have entered into agreements with train operators, while Aslef has reached agreements in Scotland and Wales.
